course_outcomes: Define data definition aspects, classify data models and produce ER diagrams.
Describe and compare relational query languages and perform query processing/optimization.
Explain storage structures like B-Tree and B+Tree and analyze storage policies.
Analyze transaction processing, serializability and concurrency control policies.
State database security policies and evaluate database security and design advancements.

subjects.prerequisites: Basic knowledge of binary number system
course_outcomes: Explain data communication systems, components and topologies.
Analyze flow control and error control mechanisms in networks.
Explain switching techniques, logical addressing, subnetting and routing.
Discuss transport layer functionality and QoS improvement techniques.
Categorize application layer protocols and their functionalities.

subjects.course_name: Artificial Intelligence for Real World Application
subjects.prerequisites: Knowledge of OOPs, Basic knowledge of Sensors
course_outcomes: Define core AI concepts and tools and their applications.
Understand and compare search and reasoning techniques in AI.
Apply AI techniques to develop ML and DL models for real problems.
Select and analyze time series methods in AI.
Evaluate TensorFlow implementations for regression and clustering.

subjects.prerequisites: Knowledge of automata theory and context free languages
course_outcomes: State different types of translators used in programming.
Understand symbol table organization and roles of semantic analysis.
Construct intermediate representations considering type systems.
Analyze optimization techniques for generated code.
Assess compiler construction tools and develop simple compilers.

subjects.prerequisites: Linear Algebra, Differential Equations, Calculus, Signals and Systems
course_outcomes: Define image processing concepts mathematically and illustrate sampling and transformations.
Classify and analyze image enhancement techniques.
Apply image restoration methods and filtering techniques.
Estimate compression efficiency and segmentation methods.

subjects.prerequisites: Basic knowledge of Biology, Mathematics and any computer language
course_outcomes: Recall basic biological science concepts with computational approaches.
Identify sequence similarity and alignment and classify biological data.
Apply rule mining for pairwise alignment and protein analysis.
Analyze and construct biological pathways and protein interactions.
Evaluate algorithms for classifying and clustering biological data.

subjects.prerequisites: Basics knowledge of networking and computer fundamentals
course_outcomes: Recall basic concepts of cloud computing.
Identify mechanisms and architectures of cloud computing.
Analyze cloud security services and architectures.
Compare different cloud services and case studies.
Apply and analyze basic database system concepts and applications.
Demonstrate SQL basics and construct queries for database operations.
Choose models and algorithms to transform data into useful information.
Develop commercial relational DB systems using SQL (Oracle, MySQL).
Explain data communications components and network topologies.
Analyze flow control and error control mechanisms.
Implement routing protocols and subnetting in simulations.
Work with transport layer concepts and improve QoS.
Develop and test application layer protocols and network configuration.

subjects.course_name: Artificial Intelligence for Real World Application Lab
subjects.prerequisites: Knowledge of OOPs, Basic knowledge of Sensors
course_outcomes: Understand preprocessing techniques for datasets and AI tool usage.
Implement supervised, unsupervised and semi-supervised ML models.
Develop deep learning programs for various models.
Analyze AI concepts to solve real world problems using TensorFlow and related tools.

subjects.prerequisites: Linear Algebra, Image Processing theory course
course_outcomes: Implement image processing operations using MATLAB.
Apply image enhancement and transformation techniques.
Analyze and implement image restoration algorithms.
Develop image segmentation and compression programs.

subjects.prerequisites: Basic knowledge of Biology and Programming
course_outcomes: Use bioinformatics databases and tools for sequence analysis.
Implement sequence alignment algorithms like Needleman-Wunsch.
Apply BLAST and ClustalW for biological sequence comparison.
Construct phylogenetic trees and perform motif finding.
Analyze protein families and structural biology data.

subjects.prerequisites: Basic knowledge of virtualization and cloud concepts
course_outcomes: Install and configure virtual machines using VirtualBox/VMware.
Deploy applications on Google App Engine.
Simulate cloud scheduling using CloudSim.
Implement Hadoop single-node setup and distributed computing.
Work with OpenStack and VM management in cloud environments.
